body:
Axiometic is a simple GUI for creating .ax files for use with [AXIOME](http://neufeld.github.com/AXIOME/). It guides the user through the creation of the configuration file, which can then be used to start an AXIOME analysis.

## Screenshots

Coming soon

## Installation

Installation is possible on Windows, Linux and Mac. Pre-built packages for all three platforms are coming soon.

### Ubuntu Precise 12.04 (or other Linux distros)
The source can be downloaded in [tarball format](http://github.com/neufeld/axiometic/tarball/master). As long as you have Python 2.6+, the GTK toolkit, and the PyGTK bindings installed (all included with Ubuntu), you can run the app by running the following commands:

     tar xvzf neufeld-axiometic-*.tar.gz
     cd neufeld-axiometic-*
     cd python-axiometic
     sudo python setup.py install

It can then be run with the command `axiometic`.

### Windows

You must install [Python](http://www.python.org/download/) and the [PyGTK all-in-one package](http://www.pygtk.org/downloads.html). The source code can be downloaded as a [zip file](http://github.com/neufeld/axiometic/zipball/master). Once extracted, you can simply double-click the python_axiometic/axiomeui.py file to run the application.
